title: VfL Wolfsburg - Wikipedia
snippet: Professional football is run by the spin-off organization VfL Wolfsburg-Fußball GmbH, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Volkswagen Group. Since 2002, Wolfsburg's stadium is the Volkswagen Arena. The city of Wolfsburg was established on 1 July 1938 under the name Stadt des KdF-Wagens bei ...

title: Volkswagen Arena - Wikipedia
snippet: Volkswagen Arena (German pronunciation: [ˈfɔlksvaːɡn̩ ʔaˌʁeːnaː]; also known as the VfL Wolfsburg Arena due to UEFA sponsorship regulations) is a football stadium in the German city of Wolfsburg, Lower Saxony. It was opened in 2002 and named after the automotive group Volkswagen AG.

title: Stadium | Volkswagen Arena and AOK Stadion | VfL Wolfsburg
snippet: The stadium also includes non-smoking and family areas in order to provide a safe environment for children and to make a visit to the Volkswagen Arena an enjoyable experience for all ages. Due to its central location, the Volkswagen Arena and adjacent AOK Stadion - home to the VfL Ladies as ...

title: Volkswagen Arena: a modern stadium in the heart of Wolfsburg
snippet: The Volkswagen Arena in Wolfsburg has been the home stadium of VfL Wolfsburg since 2002. The Arena, located in the Allerpark, has a capacity of 35,000 spectators. In addition to soccer matches, the Volkswagen Arena is also a venue for concerts and other events.

title: Volkswagen Arena - Wolfsburg - The Stadium Guide
snippet: The Volkswagen Arena is located just north-east of Wolburg’s main railway station and city centre. The walk to the stadium, during which you cross the railroad tracks and a canal, will take about 15 to 20 minutes.
